articles.title: Indian-American Presidential Candidate Calls Differences With Trump "Very Small": Report - NDTV
articles.description: Indian-American Vivek Ramaswamy has acknowledged that there were some "very small" differences between him and former US president Donald Trump but they were "deeply aligned" on policy issues.
articles.content:
Vivek Ramaswamy has effusively praised Trump throughout his campaign

articles.title: Labor Day is now a key to Election Day for Democrats and Republicans alike - NPR
articles.description: With all that has shifted around in American politics, the Democrats' disconnect from the broad working class is the loss that has cost them the most and threatens them most in the years ahead.
articles.content: Members of the International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union are seen on a Labor Day parade float, Sept. 4, 1961. While many may associate the holiday with major retail sales and end-of summer barbecu… [+11059 chars]
